discussion.content: Second question is field mappings, surely?

For deleting associated models when a manufacturer is deleted: Use a parental 1:N relationship.
For auto-populating manufacturer information when creating a model: Use a parental 1:N relationship.

Using a parental 1:N relationship allows the manufacturer data to be easily inherited by the models. When creating a new model from the model list on the manufacturer page, you can automatically pull information from the parent manufacturer record into the child model record. This allows for the auto-population of data from the manufacturer when creating new models.

For second question, I will go with "Use Field Mappings..." because we already have defined relationship type in first option. I don't believe it is reasonable to define 2 type of 1:N Relationship at the same time.

I go with:
1.) Use a parental 1:N relationship between manufacturer and model. Link: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-apps/maker/data-platform/create-edit-1n-relationships-solution-explorer#type-of-behavior-options
2.): Use field mappings in 1:N relationship between manufacturer and model Link: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-apps/maker/data-platform/map-entity-fields#add-new-mappings
